subject: History
title: The Cipher Wars of the 1500s
description: One-minute skill: The Cipher Wars of the 1500s.

hook.text: In the 1500s, codes and ciphers became weapons. The nation that broke codes first won wars.

buildup.text: Simple substitution ciphers had worked for centuries, but frequency analysis could crack them in hours.

discovery.text: The VigenÃ¨re cipher, published in 1553, used a keyword to shift letters differently. It seemed unbreakable.

twist.text: Mary Queen of Scots trusted her cipher completely. Walsingham's codebreaker Thomas Phelippes cracked it in days.

climax.text: The cipher arms race that started in the Renaissance never ended. It just moved to computers.

punchline.text: Every unbreakable code meets a better codebreaker.
